intro: Andromeda crispa, commonly known as the wrinkled andromeda, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are leathery and have a distinctive wrinkled texture, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Andromeda crispa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a specimen plant.
